Articles.Content:
Hi everyone,

I bought KSP about a year ago but never quite got the hang of it, put off by the steep learning curve and other real world distractions. I've recently started a new Career over at KSC and thanks to the helpful guides and a great deal of practice, I've just managed to rescue a stranded astronaut and safely return him to Kerbin! I'm sure in time, orbital intercepts and rescues will become second nature, but for now it's the highlight of my KSP career!

See you around

Hello and welcome to the Forums!

I've never been able to maintain a career mode save since I find it hard to do contracts, but I'm trying to do so now. Might I suggest trying to read mission reports to learn more stuff? That's how I learned a lot about KSP mechanics.

Hello deadactionman, and welcome to the forum!

There are so many moments of accomplishment in KSP, that feel so good.  Be sure to bask in the warm glow for a moment before setting your next goal.

Happy landings!
